etymologies: late 19th century. From ancient Greek τάξις arrangement, order + -odont, after scientific Latin Taxodonta, order name

definitions: Of the shell of a bivalve mollusc: having the hinge formed by a long series of similar teeth and sockets, typified (in some classification schemes) by the order Taxodonta, which contains the ark shells.

notes.text: In most recent schemes the taxon Taxodonta is no longer used. Ark shells are now usually placed in the order Arcoida.

definitions: A mollusc with a taxodont shell hinge; specifically a mollusc of the order Taxodonta.
